Summary: Large disc craft directly over a state line truckstop just a couple hundred feet above our heads
divs: sighting detailsme and a co-worker were delivering a new motor hame to las vegas. we stopped to coffee up at the state line truck stop just across the state line on i-44 where sw missouri meets ne oklahoma. as we walked toward the store front. we looked up to see a large, very large air craft directly over head "flying saucer" with round lights around the perimeter. we could only see part of the lights due to they were out of view as they progressed around the sides to the other side we could not see. it seemed to be gray\black in color with orange\yellow round lights all around the edge that we could see. it was huge. the largest thing in the air that i have ever seen. large as a county high school building. it covered most of the gas island parking lot for trucks and the store we were approaching. we looked around and no one seemed to care at all about it. customers at the gas island and the clerk gal inside the store said "no big deal, we see them all the time." "they are flown from the old closed us army and air force air fields in the quad state area. i had a camera but did not use it for concern of taking pics of classified air craft. we watched for about 15 to 20 min. i did not want to stop watching till it left that is if it was going to move. no sound no exhaust apparent. the craft then rose straight up for a long way, then tilted upward to my right side and flew away into the stary sky in a flash of speed like i have never seen before and disappeared into the dark night sky. so very cool to see an entire craft instead of just lights in the sky. it was so close to the ground and to us that i could have easily hit it with a 22 rifle or air gun. i never reported it to any authority due to my assumption that it was us classified craft. the half dozen people to whom i spoke all said that this was common place in their area and that no one ever stirs the issue. none the less it was the largest and most awesome air craft of any type that i have ever seen. thank you for listening.
